definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Let's camp out on his doorstep until we get our tickets.
sentences.chinese: 我們就在他的門階前露營，直到拿到票爲止。

sentences.english: Rain drops were spattering on the doorsteps.
A Halloween jack-o’-lantern on the doorstep.
sentences.chinese: 門階上擺着萬聖節前夜的南瓜燈。

sentences.english: Grethel seated herself on the doorstep, and began munching away at the cakes of which it was made.
sentences.chinese: 格雷特自己坐在門階上，開始咀嚼製作它的餅乾。

sentences.english: Osama sat down on the stoop of the hospital. The fighters sat around him.
sentences.chinese: 奧薩馬坐在醫院的門階上，一羣戰士圍坐身旁。
